I‘ve reproduced this issue：
https://github.com/scuwuyu/sharding-sphere-test
I hope to get your help.
**For English only**, other languages will not accept.
- Read documentation: [Sharding-Sphere Doc](http://shardingsphere.io/document/current/cn/features/sharding/usage-standard/sql/).

hi, it seems that your linked article can't be access.
I wandered that where should we invoke this register method, in sharding-sphere side or inside the transaction manager.

I think this is invoked by the sharding-sphere when initialize the TM and we could just start a recovery manager process running in the background. And the sharding-sphere need to pass all the XAResource for the database, these are used to get the in-doubt transactions in the database during the recovery scanning.

so XA recovery is depended on external recovery system implement.
we should register the XAResource when sub transaction is started. and when global transaction is finished, whether XAResource's status is need to update? I think recovery scanning process worked based on the XAResource of in-doubt transactions.

currently sharding-proxy have integrated with XA, and our local transaction is quite same with XA.
both of them need to hold the routed sharing connection untill commit command is triggered.
and performance improvement for local transaction is limit, so we decide to close this issue.

I think we can leverage init() and destroy() method using transactionManager of atomikos.
Atomikos also have the similar recovery function, which implemented by AtomikosDatasourceBean.
XA transaction event will be written in local file system, recovery thread will scan the uncommitted resource, then try to commit it again.

```
Refactor: refactor rewrite

Refactor: move MasterSlaveSQLRewriteEngine to sharding-core
@terrymanu
terrymanu committed 5 days ago

Document: java doc 
@tristaZero

Reword: add author

```
#### with git template : 
```
Improved the documentation of ss chapter xxx

# See links to relevant web pages, issue trackers, blog articles, etc.
See: https://example.com/
See: [Example Page](https://example.com/)

# List all co-authors, so version control systems can connect teams.
Co-authored-by: Name <trista@example.com>

# Why is this change happening, e.g. goals, use cases, stories, etc.?
Why: why u do that

# How is this change happening, e.g. implementations, algorithms, etc.?
How: how you do that

# Tags suitable for searching, such as hashtags, keywords, etc.
Tags: xxx
```
check this  : https://github.com/joelparkerhenderson/git_commit_message

Interesting. I just search for the mysql jdbc format [1] and it looks like can not support the aurora protocol currently ? is it from the amazon aurora [2] ?

Anyway, the pattern mentioned in the MySQLDataSourceMetaData.java should be updated to add the protocol 
```
    private final Pattern pattern = Pattern.compile("jdbc:mysql://([\\w\\-\\.]+):?([0-9]*)/([\\w\\-]+);?\\S*", Pattern.CASE_INSENSITIVE);
```

[1] https://dev.mysql.com/doc/connector-j/5.1/en/connector-j-reference-url-format.html
[2] https://aws.amazon.com/cn/rds/aurora/
